Functions
CreatePolygon2
CRefObj<IPolygon2> CreatePolygon2()

CreatePolygon2 creates a new 2D polygon

Returns

Returns new polygon object

SimplifyRecursive
void CPolygon2::SimplifyRecursive(
IPolygon2 *pResult,
int start,
int end,
float err,
float maxLen
)

SimplifyRecursive is used internally for simplifying a subpiece of the polygon

Parameters
pResult
IPolygon2*

Polygon we are adding the simplified results to

start
int

Starting index for this subpiece

end
int

Ending index for this subpiece

err
float

Tolerance to allow for points we will ignore

maxLen
float

Longest line segment allowed. If maxLen==0 then no limit.

Simplify
CRefObj<IPolygon2> CPolygon2::Simplify(
float err,
float maxLen
)

Simplify Removes points from a polygon that allow the resulting polygon to still be with 'err' units from the original polygon.  This function uses the Ramer-Douglas-Peucker algorithm: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramer�Douglas�Peucker_algorithm

Parameters
err
float

Tolerance for deciding whether to remove a point

maxLen
float

Longest line segment allowed. If maxLen==0 then no limit.

Returns

Returns the new simplified polygon

ContainsPoint
bool CPolygon2::ContainsPoint(
Vector2 &pos,
float *pMinDist = nullptr,
float *pMaxDist = nullptr
)

ContainsPoint determines whether the specified point is inside the polygon.

Parameters
pos
Vector2&

Point to rest

pMinDist
float*

Optional argument that returns the closest distance from the point to the polygon

pMaxDist
float*

Optional argument that returns the furthest distance from the point to the polygon (Hausdorff distance)
